page.title: 12Saighton Grange & grounds.
page.content: The existing building of Saighton Grange,built by the Grosvenor family, dates from the 1850s but has a tower dated 1490 (when Benedictine monks owned it).Hence the name of the secondary school there now is Abbey- gate College.This fee-paying private school has 300 pupils aged from 11 to 18 years,coming from a wide area,often by car but there is also a twice daily school bus starting in Churton & serving the Saighton primary school as well as 2 Chester schools. In the grounds the Grosvenors built a private chapel for the then,invalided, Lady Mary Grosvenor which is now used each month by Saighton village. There is also a water tower,said to be haunted,which takes water from the mains supply & stores it for the village.
